work.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to do a job that you are paid for
work.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Many young people in the area have never worked.
The injury means he’ll probably never work again.
The studies were undertaken by people working in education.
I work part-time in a library.
He works for a law firm.
She works as a consultant for a design company.
work.translation[0].definitions[0].note_: You work in a city or area
You work in a type of place such as a bank, shop, or factory
You work at a particular place or organization
She works at the Library of Congress
You work for a person, company, or organization that employs you
We both work for the same company
You work in an industry or a type of job, for example education, advertising, or IT
You work as a waiter, cashier, accountant etc
You work on a project or task
Several people worked on the report
work.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to do the activities and duties that are part of your job
work.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Staff will have to get used to a new way of working.
Are you working late (=working after the time you usually finish) again tonight?
Forty police officers are working round the clock (=working day and night without stopping) to find Murray’s killer.
Nowadays, many people are able to work from home.
I get paid more if I work nights.
We’re sometimes expected to work twelve-hour days.
One of the women I work with is getting married this weekend.
Each site has a fully trained team who work under a site manager.
work.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if you work with someone or a group of people, your job involves trying to help them
work.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: She’s just retired after 38 years working with children.
He has worked among some of the world’s poorest people.
work.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to spend time and effort doing something
work.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I’ve been working in the garden all afternoon.
I’m going to have to work really hard to pass these exams.
We’re working together to develop a new system.
work.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to try continuously to achieve a particular thing
work.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The company is working hard to improve its image.
He worked tirelessly (=worked very hard in a determined way) for the charity throughout his life.
They are working towards a solution to their problems.
We will work for the release of the hostages.
The police are working to provide more help for victims of crime.
work.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: if a machine or piece of equipment works, it does what it is supposed to do
work.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: You should check that the smoke alarm is working properly.
I can’t get the heater to work.
work.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: to make a machine or piece of equipment do what it is supposed to do
work.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: My parents can’t even work the video.
work.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: Making a marriage work can take a lot of effort.
I’ve never found a diet that works.
The recipe works just as well if you use margarine instead of butter.
The cream works immediately to relieve sore skin.
You need to find which method works best for you.
a drug that works against some types of cancer
work.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: if something such as a fact, situation, or system works in a particular way, it has a particular effect on someone or something
work.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: The arrangement works well for everyone involved.
The French team are the heavier crew, which should work in their favour (=help them).
Sexism still works against (=harms or causes problems for) women in many professions.
Loyalty works both ways (=involves two opposite or matching effects): we are loyal to our employees and, in turn, they are loyal to us.
work.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: if a painting, design, piece of writing etc works, it is successful because it has the effect on you that the painter, writer etc intended
work.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: I don’t think the scene with the horses really works, do you?
The colour combination just doesn’t work for me.
work.translation[0].definitions[10].defi: if you work a material such as metal, leather, or clay, you cut, sew, or shape it in order to make something
work.translation[0].definitions[11].defi: to use a particular material or substance in order to make something such as a picture, design, jewellery etc
work.translation[0].definitions[11].exam: a sculptor who works in steel
a jeweller who works with silver
work.translation[0].definitions[12].defi: to move into a particular state or position very gradually, either in a series of small movements or after a long time
work.translation[0].definitions[12].exam: Slowly he worked the screwdriver into the crack.
One of the screws must have worked loose.
work.translation[0].definitions[13].defi: to use and exercise a muscle or part of your body
work.translation[0].definitions[13].exam: Swimming is a form of exercise that works every muscle in your body.
work.translation[0].definitions[14].defi: if a part of your body works or you work it, it moves
work.translation[0].definitions[14].exam: She was trembling and her mouth was working.
work.translation[0].definitions[15].defi: if you work a particular area or type of place, you travel around the area for your job, or work in that type of place
work.translation[0].definitions[16].defi: if an entertainer or politician works a crowd of people, they entertain them and get their interest or support
work.translation[0].definitions[16].exam: She really knew how to work a crowd.
work.translation[0].definitions[17].defi: if you work the land, soil etc, you do all the work necessary to grow crops on it
work.translation[0].definitions[17].exam: He was left to work the farm alone.
work.translation[0].definitions[18].defi: to remove a substance such as coal, gold, or oil from under the ground
work.translation[0].definitions[19].defi: if your mind or brain is working, you are thinking or trying to solve a problem
work.translation[0].definitions[20].defi: to calculate the answer to a mathematical problem
work.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a job or activity that you do regularly, especially in order to earn money
work.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: There isn’t a lot of work at this time of the year.
He’s been out of work (=without a job) for two years.
More people are in work (=have a job) than ten years ago.
Do you want to go for a drink after work?
work.translation[1].definitions[0].note_: In this meaning, work is always an uncountable noun
It may be hard for older people to find work
I applied for a job as a reporter
Her first job was in London
Her first work was in London
work.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a place where you do your job, which is not your home
work.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: I had an accident on the way to work.
He left work at the usual time.
I went out with the girls from work last night.
work.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: the duties and activities that are part of your job
work.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: A large part of the work we do involves using computers.
He’s started a business doing gardening and roofing work.
work.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: something that you produce as a result of doing your job or doing an activity
work.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: Send a résumé and examples of your work.
The building is the work of architect Rafael Moneo.
The teacher should make sure that each child has a piece of work displayed on the wall.
The standard of work has declined.
work.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: the papers and other materials you need for doing work
work.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: Can you move some of your work off the kitchen table?
I often have to take work home with me.
work.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: something such as a painting, play, piece of music etc that is produced by a painter, writer, or musician
work.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: It is another accomplished work by the artist.
work.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: when you use physical or mental effort in order to achieve something
work.translation[1].definitions[6].examp: Looking after children can be hard work.
You should not allow unqualified people to carry out work on your house.
set to work/get down to work
Work will start next month on a new swimming pool in the centre of the city.
work.translation[1].definitions[7].defin: study or research, especially for a particular purpose
work.translation[1].definitions[7].examp: The centre carries out work to monitor trends in housing management.
He did his postgraduate work in Sociology.
work.translation[1].definitions[8].defin: an operation to make you look younger or more attractive
work.translation[1].definitions[8].examp: All these celebrities have had work done.
work.translation[1].note_box[0].heading: – Meanings 1 & 3
work.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: start work
He started work as a trainee accountant.
look for work
Young people come to town looking for work.
find work
It was difficult for them to find work.
return to work/go back to work
His doctor agreed he was fit enough to return to work.
ADJECTIVES/NOUN + work
part-time work
In recent years part-time work has become more popular.
full-time work
Are you available for full-time work?
paid work
She hasn’t done any paid work since she had children.
secretarial/clerical/office work
I have a background in secretarial work.
She had done clerical work before she married.
legal work
He will handle all the legal work.
manual work
Most of them were employed in manual work.
voluntary work
She also did voluntary work in a girls’ club.
somebody’s daily work
When they finished their daily work they would be too tired for much except rest.
somebody’s line of work
I meet lots of interesting people in my line of work.
the work environment
It is important to have a pleasant work environment.
work practices
She supported me enthusiastically in bringing in new work practices.
work.translation[1].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 7: when you use physical or mental effort in order to achieve something
work.translation[1].note_box[1].sections: carry out work
The work should be carried out without further delay.
do work
He was doing some work on his father’s car.
set to/get to/get down to work
They set to work cutting down trees and brushwood.
undertake work
About a three adults in ten undertake voluntary work.
work starts/begins
Work had already started on the bridge when the error was spotted.
work continues
Work is continuing on three major building projects.
It’s been very hard work, but I’ve loved every moment of it.
backbreaking
Clearing the garden was slow, backbreaking work.
arduous
This was physically arduous work.
heavy work
The heavy work is done by the gardener.
light work
He had been ill, but she found him some light work to do.
work.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to do a job that you are paid for
work.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Most of the people I went to school with work in factories.
David works for a broadcasting company.
She works as a financial consultant.
work.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to do the activities or duties that are part of your job
work.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: I’m tired of working ten-hour days.
work.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: to travel around a particular area as part of your job, especially in order to sell something
work.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: to do an activity which needs time and effort
work.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: We had to work non-stop to get the book finished on time.
work.translation[2].definitions[4].defin: to make someone use a lot of time and effort in a job or activity
work.translation[2].definitions[4].examp: The company is famous for working its employees hard.
work.translation[2].definitions[5].defin: if you work a particular material such as metal, leather etc, you cut or shape it in order to make something
work.translation[2].definitions[6].defin: to do all the work necessary to grow crops on a piece of land
work.translation[2].definitions[6].examp: Our family has worked this land for generations.
work.translation[2].definitions[7].defin: to remove a substance such as coal, gold, or oil from a mine
work.translation[2].definitions[8].defin: if a machine or piece of equipment works, it does what it is supposed to do
work.translation[2].definitions[9].defin: to operate a machine or piece of equipment
work.translation[2].definitions[9].examp: The check-out is slow, because only two clerks work the cash registers.
work.translation[2].definitions[10].defi: if a method, plan, or system works, it produces the results you want
work.translation[2].definitions[10].exam: The article gives a good understanding of how the pharmaceutical research process works.
work.translation[2].definitions[11].defi: if something such as a fact, situation, or system works in a particular way, it has a particular effect on somebody or something
work.translation[2].definitions[11].exam: The tax laws tend to work against small companies.
work.translation[2].definitions[12].defi: to know how to influence an organization etc in order to achieve something
work.translation[2].definitions[12].exam: Those who advance in this environment are people with an instinct for securing supplies, cultivating connections and working the system.
work.translation[2].definitions[13].defi: if you work your way up, or work your way up in an organization, your jobs in it become more and more important
work.translation[2].definitions[13].exam: They have spent their entire careers at the firm and worked their way up the ranks.
work.translation[2].definitions[14].defi: to protest about a situation at work by doing your job less quickly or effectively than usual, but without breaking your employer’s rules or the terms of your contract
work.translation[2].definitions[14].exam: The staff are not on strike but are working to rule.
work.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: the job you are paid to do or an activity that you do regularly to earn money
work.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: My father started work when he was 14.
The work was interesting and well paid.
He eventually found work on a construction site.
She’s been out of work (=not had a job) for almost a year now.
He has been off work (=not working because of illness) for four weeks because of his wrist condition.
Many women take part-time work while they are raising children.
6.3 million people are working part time but would prefer full-time work.
work.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: a place where you do your job, which is not your home
work.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: He left work at the usual time.
work.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: the duties and activities that are part of your job
work.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: What kind of work are you looking for?
A large part of the work we do involves using computers.
I wouldn’t be very good at manual work (=hard physical work).
work.translation[3].definitions[3].defin: work or products that are in the process of being done or made, but are not yet finished
work.translation[3].definitions[3].examp: Some journals expect editors to retain responsibility for work in progress when they leave.
work.translation[3].definitions[4].defin: work or products that are in the process of being done or made, but are not yet finished
